exemplars.name: Werner Vogels
exemplars.track_record: CTO of Amazon since 2005; instrumental in building AWS; PhD in computer science; former researcher at Cornell University
exemplars.constraints: Built AWS from scratch to become the world's largest cloud platform; faced massive scaling challenges; maintained high reliability and security standards
notable_actions: Architected AWS with service-oriented design enabling independent scaling of components
Pioneered the concept of 'you build it, you run it' operational model
Emphasized distributed systems principles and fault tolerance in cloud architecture
Advocated for API-first design and loose coupling between services
Implemented comprehensive monitoring and observability as core platform capabilities

exemplars.name: Jeff Rothschild
exemplars.track_record: VP of Engineering at Facebook (Meta); former VP at Veritas Software; scaled Facebook from millions to billions of users
exemplars.constraints: Joined Facebook during critical growth phase; had to rebuild infrastructure for massive scale; faced unprecedented technical challenges
notable_actions: Redesigned Facebook's infrastructure to handle exponential user growth
Implemented sharding and caching strategies to scale database operations
Built engineering culture focused on reliability and rapid iteration
Established technical standards and best practices for web-scale systems
Led technical integration of major acquisitions including Instagram and WhatsApp

exemplars.name: Adrian Cockcroft
exemplars.track_record: VP of Cloud Architecture at AWS; former Cloud Architect at Netflix; pioneered cloud-native architecture patterns
exemplars.constraints: Led Netflix's migration from data centers to AWS; had to maintain service during migration; established cloud-native best practices
notable_actions: Developed Netflix's Chaos Monkey to test system resilience
Pioneered microservices architecture patterns at scale
Established cloud migration strategies that became industry standards
Advocated for fault-tolerant design and graceful degradation
Created open-source tools (Eureka, Hystrix, Zuul) that became foundational to cloud-native development
